pullRequest.body:
Replaces `Lean.Expr.swapBVars` with a version that traverses the expression.


---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

nodes.body:
### PR summary [daf35dc829](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/22888/commits/daf35dc82959a98fb8550a2137e029f38c8b09fa)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

No declarations were harmed in the making of this PR! üêô
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](https://speed.lean-lang.org/mathlib4/run-detail/9c25190e-095d-4954-8d22-7bdc72ba4818) for commit a469bf00f49e542320a2d018f2253e322b0be27b.
There were [no significant changes](https://speed.lean-lang.org/mathlib4/compare/cc4e10cc-bb23-4f48-9c18-e5d808649291/to/9c25190e-095d-4954-8d22-7bdc72ba4818) against commit bb749e53d0aee387fb458be7a348963e03f56702.

No benchmark entry differed by at least +1.0‚¨ù10‚Åπ instructions.
[CI run](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13822960141)

Looks good to me, thank you!

I had to look these things up, therefore I'll leave them here for reference:

- `.forallE`, `.letE`, `.lam` increase the [de-brujin-index](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/De_Bruijn_index) of `bvar`s inside their body, thus the `(¬∑ + 1)`
- `| _ => e` is equivalent to the following, which all do not contain any `bvar`s:
  ```
  | .lit _ => e
  | .const _ _ => e
  | .sort _ => e
  | .mvar _ => e
  | .fvar _ => e
  ```

maintainer merge
üöÄ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by joneugster.
üöÄ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by joneugster.

> * `| _ => e` is equivalent to the following, which all do not contain any `bvar`s:
>   ```
>   | .lit _ => e
>   | .const _ _ => e
>   | .sort _ => e
>   | .mvar _ => e
>   | .fvar _ => e
>   ```

Let's make that explicit then, perhaps as
```
| .lit _
| .const _ _
| .sort _
| .mvar _
| .fvar _ =>
  e
```

The benchmark suggests this is very marginally slower, not faster; do we have reason to believe this version is better? It's possible the original leverages a cache for repeated subexpressions, and so this is in fact worse.
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](https://speed.lean-lang.org/mathlib4/run-detail/168220e2-0ee7-4918-8af5-5b8d12f02d08) for commit e3230802478514c0e79da0e9f8dbb23f7912f4e6.
There were [no significant changes](https://speed.lean-lang.org/mathlib4/compare/cc4e10cc-bb23-4f48-9c18-e5d808649291/to/168220e2-0ee7-4918-8af5-5b8d12f02d08) against commit bb749e53d0aee387fb458be7a348963e03f56702.

No benchmark entry differed by at least +1.0‚¨ù10‚Åπ instructions.
[CI run](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13910405253)
I don't think it's significant

```suggestion
| .bvar n => .bvar (if n = i then j else if n = j then i else n)
```
Actually, this is a bad idea

```suggestion
| .bvar n => if n = i then .bvar j else if n = j then .bvar i else e
```
which should allow the `!` methods below to kick in

Should I add this?
```suggestion
def _root_.Lean.Expr.swapBVars (e : Expr) (i j : Nat) : Expr := if i = j then e else match e with
```
The only place this function is used is in `Tactic/FunProp/Core` with `i := 0` and `j := 1`.
Yes, that seems pretty sensible to me

pullRequest.title: perf: replace `Lean.Expr.swapBVars` with a better? implementation
